DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study evaluate effect access nutrition service pregnancy outcomes obese urban population . Approximately one fourth woman United States overweight nearly one third consider obese . Pregnancy place obese woman increase risk several adverse event antepartum , intrapartum , postpartum period . There many study show obesity pregnancy negative impact pregnancy . However , currently study United States specifically look ease access nutrition service obese urban population effect pregnancy outcomes . This study randomize control study compare two group pregnant woman BMI 30 great one access nutritional service along routine prenatal care get routine prenatal care . The investigator hypothesize obese parturient access nutritional service decrease weight gain pregnancy ultimately improved pregnancy outcomes . This help guide future care obese parturient urban population may limit access service .
